workouts.name: Cardio Drift Test
workouts.detailed_description:
You need a power meter for this test.

Ride for one hour at ~70% of your threshold.

Minimise irregular caffeine consumption (if you usually have a coffee before your ride, keep that the same) and keep everything else in your daily routine as normal as possible (time of day for ride, food etc). Stay hydrated and cool with a fan if needed during the test to ensure no external factors influence your heart rate.

Ensure that you maintain the same cadence throughout (whatever is most comfortable for you) the test so we can directly measure what your heart rate is doing without influence from changing cadence.

Can you please let us know what the environmental conditions are at the time of the test? Eg- Summer, 30 degrees Celsius, 90% humidity.

workouts.name: 2hr Base Fitness
workouts.detailed_description:
Riding on the trainer or outside in Zone 2 at a comfortable cadence.

The aim of this ride is to improve your efficiency at a low aerobic power, build mitochondria and increase your ability to utilise fat as a fuel source. Listen to your body and watch your HR to remain in zone 2.

Avoid going above zone 2 at all times and ride with constant pressure on the pedals on both up and down hills.

If you want to improve your efficiency in a more aerodynamic position spend some time in the drops/ aero position so your muscles can develop strength in that position.

Ride at a comfortable cadence in the 80-100rpm range where possible.

workouts.name: 1hr Base Fitness @ 60-65% Threshold (Variant 1)
workouts.detailed_description:
Riding on the trainer or outside in low to mid Zone 2 at a comfortable cadence.

This is slightly easier than a typical zone 2 ride at 60-65% threshold. The aim here to reduce the pressure on the legs and bring the heart rate into the desired zone to see what response your body has.

The aim of this ride is to improve your efficiency at a low aerobic power, build mitochondria and increase your ability to utilise fat as a fuel source. Listen to your body and watch your HR to remain in zone 2.

Avoid going above zone 2 at all times and ride with constant pressure on the pedals on both up and down hills.

If you want to improve your efficiency in a more aerodynamic position spend some time in the drops/ aero position so your muscles can develop strength in that position.

Ride at a comfortable cadence in the 80-100rpm range where possible.

workouts.name: 3x12' Tempo
workouts.detailed_description:
Aim here is to target time in zone 3 and increase your muscular endurance with sustained pressure on the pedals at a moderate intensity.

These shouldn't be too hard but should start to hurt towards the end of the last efforts.

Change position from hoods to drops throughout these efforts to engage different muscle groups.

Stick to prescribed power targets as we are targeting a specific HR and power zone for aerobic capacity.

workouts.name: 3x15' Tempo
workouts.detailed_description:
Aim here is to target time in zone 3 and increase your muscular endurance with sustained pressure on the pedals at a moderate intensity.

These shouldn't be too hard but should start to hurt towards the end of the last efforts.

Change position from hoods to drops throughout these efforts to engage different muscle groups.

Stick to prescribed power targets as we are targeting a specific HR and power zone for aerobic capacity.

workouts.name: Active Recovery
workouts.detailed_description:
Zone 1 power
Cadence 85+rpm
This goal of this session is to aid your recovery on the bike by getting blood flow to your working muscles.

workouts.name: FTP Progression 2 5x7
workouts.detailed_description:
FTP progression #2.
Get stuck in and enjoy!!

workouts.name: Wahoo SYSTM: FTP Over Unders: 3 sets 8x1
workouts.detailed_description:
Go to the Wahoo SYSTM app and select: FTP OVER-UNDERS: 3 SETS 8 X 1

If you can't access the Wahoo SYSTM app or want to complete this session on the road, please find a quite road either on the flat or a consistent hill approximately 8minutes in length and follow the workout description below.

workouts.name: General Endurance
workouts.detailed_description:
The aim of this ride is to work on your aerobic endurance so please try to stay in zone 2 as much as possible and zone 3 when you're climbing if you're feeling good.

You can do this ride solo, in a group or a combination of both. Just focus on enjoying the ride and not emptying the tank.

You should be aiming to consume 40-60grams carbs for rides up to 2hrs OR 60-80g carbs for >2.5hrs.

workouts.name: Zone 2 with Cadence Variation
workouts.detailed_description: Base training session aiming for zone 2 power range but adding in some cadence variations and power changes to keep things engaging and neurally challenging as well.

workouts.name: 4hr Base Fitness
workouts.detailed_description:
Riding on the trainer or outside in Zone 2 at a comfortable cadence.

The aim of this ride is to improve your efficiency at a low aerobic power, build mitochondria and increase your ability to utilise fat as a fuel source. Listen to your body and watch your HR to remain in zone 2.

Avoid going above zone 2 at all times and ride with constant pressure on the pedals on both up and down hills.

If you want to improve your efficiency in a more aerodynamic position spend some time in the drops/ aero position so your muscles can develop strength in that position.

Ride at a comfortable cadence in the 80-100rpm range where possible.

workouts.name: Tempo Repeats 3x15min (1.2hr)
workouts.detailed_description:
Aim here is to target time in zone 3 and increase your muscular endurance with sustained pressure on the pedals at a moderate intensity.

These shouldn't be too hard but should start to hurt towards the end of the last efforts.

Change position from hoods to drops throughout these efforts to engage different muscle groups.

Stick to prescribed power targets as we are targeting a specific HR and power zone for aerobic capacity.

workouts.name: Tempo Repeats 3x15min (1.7hr)
workouts.detailed_description:
Aim here is to target time in zone 3 and increase your muscular endurance with sustained pressure on the pedals at a moderate intensity.

These shouldn't be too hard but should start to hurt towards the end of the last efforts.

Change position from hoods to drops throughout these efforts to engage different muscle groups.

Stick to prescribed power targets as we are targeting a specific HR and power zone for aerobic capacity.

workouts.name: The Benchmark Test!
workouts.detailed_description:
Find your favourite 3-12 minute effort/climb in your local area. We're going for a personal best today! If you can't think of anything in your local area, you have 2 other options:

1- Find a segment on zwift that you want to substitute for outside. I.e. the Volcano KOM or Epic KOM.

2- You can choose a certain time frame. I.e. 5min or 10min and just go as hard as you can for that period of time to get your best power for that time frame.

You're going to rip it as hard as you can go.

Be careful not to go too hard out of the blocks!

Also, you may want to ride the climb at a lower intensity first, You can do your 'priming' efforts up the climb, roll down, and then off you go.

Priming efforts will open the doors to your upper-end systems before you go all out. They include:

3 X 1 min efforts between Zone 4 - Zone 5 with 1 min rest in-between. This is to be done before you rip it up the hill.

Good luck.

workouts.name: 5min Strength Efforts (Zone 3) 4x5min (57min)
workouts.detailed_description:
These sessions are to build muscular strength on the bike by increasing the amount of time your muscles are contracting each pedal stroke with a lower cadence (increased torque). By doing this, we aim to increase your force production throughout the pedal stroke.

It is okay to do these sessions as hill repeats where you coast/ free wheel a bit down the hill during your recovery period to start your next effort.

It is important if you are doing this session on the trainer or on flat road to pedal at a high cadence (85-95rpm) to flush your legs out during the recovery periods.

Ideally this session is done on the ergo or on a hill with a steady gradient.

If completing on the ergo, you can make the warm up and cool down 10min.

workouts.name: Base Fitness Training (Zone Two) 1.8hr
workouts.detailed_description:
Riding on the trainer or outside in Zone 2 at a comfortable cadence for 1.5 hours with 5mins warm up and a 10mins cooldown in Zone 1 at the end.

If you want to improve your efficiency in a more aerodynamic position spend some time in the drops. For example: 5 mins on drops every 30mins.

workouts.name: Sweet Spot Repeats
workouts.detailed_description:
Efforts just below threshold.

At this percentage of FTP, you are at a physiological point where the lactate clearance and utilisation is at a steady state. This type of training will improve your ability to clear accumulated lactate when necessary and improve your muscular endurance.

If you are aiming to improve your climbing, do these as repeats on a climb. If you want to improve your speed on the flat, do these on a flat road without interruptions.

You can also complete these workouts on the trainer as prescribed below.

workouts.name: Base Fitness Training (Zone Two) 2.2hr
workouts.detailed_description:
Riding in Zone 2 for two hours at a comfortable cadence with 5mins warm-up and a 5min cooldown in Zone 1

If you want to improve your efficiency in a more aerodynamic position spend some time in the drops. For example: 5 mins on drops every 30mins.

workouts.name: 40/20s (5min) 2x1min (58min)
workouts.detailed_description:
Aim is to accumulate a decent amount of time in and above zone 5. You will get a short 20sec rest that allows your legs to recover but your heart rate won't drop too much and then you have to go again.

The first couple of sets should be done to target power. If you feel good, you can treat the 40sec effort as a max effort to really push your body to the limit.

If you do this session on the ergo, please don't use ERG mode as the lag in resistance can be difficult and you will also limit yourself in the power range given sometimes. You are better off doing this as a free ride in level mode and producing the power yourself.

Ensure your cadence doesn't drop too much in your recovery period. Recovery cadence should be >85rpm when possible.

workouts.name: VO2 Repeats 5x3'
workouts.detailed_description:
These sessions work on your top end power.
VO2/ Zone 5 work can be really difficult but it is all about getting the most out of your efforts and recovery well before each effort!
Aim for the bottom-mid range in the first couple of efforts and if you are feeling good you can push the power a bit higher and try to finish the last effort by emptying the tank. It is okay to go above power zone prescribed in these sessions as this is about getting everything out of yourself to prepare you for those testing sessions and hard races!

workouts.name: 5min Strength Efforts (Zone 3) 4x5min (1.2hr)
workouts.detailed_description:
These sessions are to build muscular strength on the bike by increasing the amount of time your muscles are contracting each pedal stroke with a lower cadence (increased torque). By doing this, we aim to increase your force production throughout the pedal stroke.

It is okay to do these sessions as hill repeats where you coast/ free wheel a bit down the hill during your recovery period to start your next effort.

It is important if you are doing this session on the trainer or on flat road to pedal at a high cadence (85-95rpm) to flush your legs out during the recovery periods.

Ideally this session is done on the ergo or on a hill with a steady gradient.

If completing on the ergo, you can make the warm up and cool down 10min.

workouts.name: 5min Strength Efforts
workouts.detailed_description:
These sessions are to build muscular strength on the bike by increasing the amount of time your muscles are contracting each pedal stroke with a lower cadence (increased torque). By doing this, we aim to increase your force production throughout the pedal stroke.

It is okay to do these sessions as hill repeats where you coast/ free wheel a bit down the hill during your recovery period to start your next effort.

It is important if you are doing this session on the trainer or on flat road to pedal at a high cadence (85-95rpm) to flush your legs out during the recovery periods.

Ideally this session is done on the ergo or on a hill with a steady gradient.

If completing on the ergo, you can make the warm up and cool down 10min.

The aim of this ride is to improve your efficiency at a low aerobic power, build mitochondria and increase your ability to utilise fat as a fuel source. Listen to your body and watch your HR to remain in zone 2.

Avoid going above zone 2 at all times and ride with constant pressure on the pedals on both up and down hills.

If you want to improve your efficiency in a more aerodynamic position spend some time in the drops/ aero position so your muscles can develop strength in that position.

Ride at a comfortable cadence in the 80-100rpm range where possible.

workouts.name: 1hr Base Fitness 1.2hr
workouts.detailed_description:
Riding on the trainer or outside in Zone 2 at a comfortable cadence.

The aim of this ride is to improve your efficiency at a low aerobic power, build mitochondria and increase your ability to utilise fat as a fuel source. Listen to your body and watch your HR to remain in zone 2.

Ride at a comfortable cadence in the 80-100rpm range where possible.

workouts.name: 1.5hr Base Fitness @ 60-65% Threshold
workouts.detailed_description:
Riding on the trainer or outside in low to mid Zone 2 at a comfortable cadence.

This is slightly easier than a typical zone 2 ride at 60-65% threshold. The aim here to reduce the pressure on the legs and bring the heart rate into the desired zone to see what response your body has.

The aim of this ride is to improve your efficiency at a low aerobic power, build mitochondria and increase your ability to utilise fat as a fuel source. Listen to your body and watch your HR to remain in zone 2.

Avoid going above zone 2 at all times and ride with constant pressure on the pedals on both up and down hills.

If you want to improve your efficiency in a more aerodynamic position spend some time in the drops/ aero position so your muscles can develop strength in that position.

Ride at a comfortable cadence in the 80-100rpm range where possible.

workouts.name: Threshold 5x6min
workouts.detailed_description:
This is a series of threshold efforts.

The focus is on building the time spent in that threshold zone, so you'll see they initially start quite short to get you used to training in this zone, but the time extends as the weeks go on. We are focusing on increasing the time at this stage, not the intensity. This will force your body to work aerobically and build the metabolic machinery that results in a higher threshold, while also increasing your Time to Exhaustion (TTE) which is a key determinant of endurance performance.

Focus on keeping a comfortable cadence. You can do these efforts on hills or flats if you're riding outside, but just make sure the recovery intervals are as set out below. It may be easier to get these done indoors, on Zwift etc.

workouts.name: 10min Strength Efforts
workouts.detailed_description:
These sessions are to build muscular strength on the bike by increasing the amount of time your muscles are contracting each pedal stroke with a lower cadence. My doing this, we aim to increase your ability to push higher power and should translate to racing when you operate at a higher cadence.

It is okay to do these sessions as hill repeats where you coast/ free wheel a bit down the hill during your recovery period to start your next effort.

It is important if you are doing this session on the trainer or on flat road to pedal at a high cadence (85-95rpm) to flush your legs out during the recovery periods.

Ideally this session is done on the ergo or on a hill with a steady gradient.

If completing on the ergo, you can make the warm up and cool down 10min.

workouts.name: Threshold 4x8min
workouts.detailed_description:
This is a series of threshold efforts.

The focus is on building the time spent in that threshold zone, so you'll see they initially start quite short to get you used to training in this zone, but the time extends as the weeks go on. We are focusing on increasing the time at this stage, not the intensity. This will force your body to work aerobically and build the metabolic machinery that results in a higher threshold, while also increasing your Time to Exhaustion (TTE) which is a key determinant of endurance performance.

Focus on keeping a comfortable cadence. You can do these efforts on hills or flats if you're riding outside, but just make sure the recovery intervals are as set out below. It may be easier to get these done indoors, on Zwift etc.

workouts.name: Base Fitness Training (Zone Two) 1.2hr
workouts.detailed_description:
Riding on the trainer or outside in Zone 2 at a comfortable cadence

If you want to improve your efficiency in a more aerodynamic position spend some time in the drops. For example: 5 mins on drops every 30mins.

workouts.name: 2x20' Tempo
workouts.detailed_description:
Aim here is to target time in zone 3 and increase your muscular endurance with sustained pressure on the pedals at a moderate intensity.

These shouldn't be too hard but should start to hurt towards the end of the last efforts.

Change position from hoods to drops throughout these efforts to engage different muscle groups.

Stick to prescribed power targets as we are targeting a specific HR and power zone for aerobic capacity.

workouts.name: 1hr Base Fitness @ 60-65% Threshold (Variant 2)
workouts.detailed_description:
Riding on the trainer or outside in low to mid Zone 2 at a comfortable cadence.

This is slightly easier than a typical zone 2 ride at 60-65% threshold. The aim here to reduce the pressure on the legs and bring the heart rate into the desired zone to see what response your body has.

The aim of this ride is to improve your efficiency at a low aerobic power, build mitochondria and increase your ability to utilise fat as a fuel source. Listen to your body and watch your HR to remain in zone 2.

Avoid going above zone 2 at all times and ride with constant pressure on the pedals on both up and down hills.

If you want to improve your efficiency in a more aerodynamic position spend some time in the drops/ aero position so your muscles can develop strength in that position.

Ride at a comfortable cadence in the 80-100rpm range where possible.

workouts.name: Tempo with spikes 2x1min (1.4hr)
workouts.detailed_description: Steady state efforts with a spikes in power to challenge your steady state system.

workouts.name: 30/30s (3x10')
workouts.detailed_description:
These short hard efforts with short recovery are focused on your ability to repeat an effort and recover in a short period of time.

These should not be too difficult to begin with but will become harder towards the end and the longer the complete effort is.

Aim is to do these seated as much as possible. Once comfortable with power and you understand the demands of this session, you can push above the limits of the power suggestion IF you are feeling good.

workouts.name: Tempo with spikes 2x1min (1.6hr)
workouts.detailed_description: Steady state efforts with a spikes in power to challenge your steady state system.

workouts.name: 40/20s (5min) 2x1min (1.3hr)
workouts.detailed_description:
Aim is to accumulate a decent amount of time in and above zone 5. You will get a short 20sec rest that allows your legs to recover but your heart rate won't drop too much and then you have to go again.

The first couple of sets should be done to target power. If you feel good, you can treat the 40sec effort as a max effort to really push your body to the limit.

If you do this session on the ergo, please don't use ERG mode as the lag in resistance can be difficult and you will also limit yourself in the power range given sometimes. You are better off doing this as a free ride in level mode and producing the power yourself.

Ensure your cadence doesn't drop too much in your recovery period. Recovery cadence should be >85rpm when possible.

workouts.name: 120/60s
workouts.detailed_description:
Aim is to accumulate a decent amount of time just above your Threshold.

Stick to the target power for these efforts. You can lift 10-20w but try to stay close as they will creep up on you in the last couple of repeats.

If you do this session on the ergo, please don't use ERG mode as the lag in resistance can be difficult and you will also limit yourself in the power range given sometimes. You are better off doing this as a free ride in level mode and producing the power yourself.

Ensure your cadence doesn't drop too much in your recovery period. Recovery cadence should be >85rpm when possible.

workouts.name: Activations
workouts.detailed_description:
This is a session used to prepare your body for the next days activity. We use this to prime your muscles so that they are ready to perform and this is a proven way to maximise your performance.

The warm up section can be longer than prescribed below to find a safe road or if you feel your legs need more time.

workouts.name: Threshold Test (5' + 20')
workouts.detailed_description:
This is your typical 20min test with the all out 5min effort all out effort prior to your 20min FTP test. The reason you do the 5min all out effort is to remove the anaerobic contribution to your 'aerobic threshold'. You will have plenty of time to recover after the 5min effort before doing your 20min effort. We will take 95% of your average power across the 20minutes as your FTP.

Do this test either on a hill, a flat consistent road with no interruptions or on a flat criterium track.

The best way to approach this test is to have a target in mind so that you don't go out too hard. You want to manage your effort well at the start so you can maintain the right power. You should aim for similar to your previous best to begin with or even slightly higher and then once you know you are capable of more and feel strong, lift 10-20w and hold on for as long as you can. Don't worry if you power drops off, just keep pushing as hard as you can. If you feel like you have energy left in the final few minutes, empty the tank.

You should finish this test completely empty, so don't leave anything on the road!!

Good luck and give it your all!

workouts.name: Stanny Loop 3x1min
workouts.detailed_description:
Find your favourite 3-12 minute effort/climb in your local area. We're going for a personal best today! If you can't think of anything in your local area, you have 2 other options:

1- Find a segment on zwift that you want to substitute for outside. I.e. the Volcano KOM or Epic KOM.

2- You can choose a certain time frame. I.e. 5min or 10min and just go as hard as you can for that period of time to get your best power for that time frame.

You're going to rip it as hard as you can go.

Be careful not to go too hard out of the blocks!

Also, you may want to ride the climb at a lower intensity first, You can do your 'priming' efforts up the climb, roll down, and then off you go.

Priming efforts will open the doors to your upper-end systems before you go all out. They include:

3 X 1 min efforts between Zone 4 - Zone 5 with 1 min rest in-between. This is to be done before you rip it up the hill.

Good luck.

workouts.name: Tempo with spikes 2x1min (1.2hr)
workouts.detailed_description: Steady state efforts with a spikes in power to challenge your steady state system.

workouts.name: Sub Threshold Efforts 4x10min
workouts.detailed_description:
These longer bike sessions are mostly done at an easy/steady Z2 effort, but there is a main set of long efforts at just below your threshold pace. These will help increase your threshold power without leaving you feeling excessively tired afterwards.

Warm Up:
20 mins in Z2.

Main Set:
4 x (10 mins in upper Z3 + 5 min recoveries in Z2).

Warm Down:
10 mins in low Z2.

workouts.name: Aerobic Endurance Ride 3hr
workouts.detailed_description: Ride mainly in Z2 today. You should be able to maintain conversation at this intensity.

workouts.name: Sub Threshold, Low Cadence Efforts.
workouts.detailed_description:
Think of this like a bike-specific gym strength workout. It will increase cycling related leg-strength which will help you get more power out of each pedal stroke.

Warm Up:
10 mins in Z2,
5 x (15 secs in upper Z3 + 45 secs in low Z2).

Main Set:
3 x (10 mins in upper Z3 at 60-70 RPM + 2 min recoveries in low Z2 at 80-100 RPM).

Warm Down:
5 mins in low Z2.

workouts.name: OPTIONAL: Aerobic Endurance Bike 5x20s (48min)
workouts.detailed_description:
Warm Up:
5 mins in Z2,
5 x (20 secs in Z3 + 40 secs in low Z2).

Main Set:
5 x (5 mins at upper Z2 + 30 sec recoveries in low Z2).

Warm Down:
5 mins in low Z2.

workouts.name: Fitness Test: FTP and Threshold HR (50 mins)
workouts.detailed_description:
Use the results from this test to calculate your thresholds and personalise your training.
https://bit.ly/EnterBikeZones (article)

Warm Up:
15 mins in Z2,
5 mins as (15 secs in Z4 + 45 secs easy in Z2).

Main Set:
20 mins maximal steady state time trial. Go as hard as you can sustain for 20 minutes.

Warm Down:
10 mins in Z2.

Your Functional Threshold Power (FTP) is your average power for the 20-minute test multiplied by 95%.

Your Bike Threshold Heart Rate is your average for the 20-minute test less 6 beats.

workouts.name: M.A.P Efforts 5x10s (57min)
workouts.detailed_description:
M.A.P stands for Maximal Aerobic Power. It refers to the power output you can ride while at your maximal rate of oxygen consumption. These workouts include efforts that are at or just below your M.A.P.

Warm Up:
12 mins in Z2,
5 x (10 secs in Z5 + 50 secs in low Z2),
3 mins in Z2.

Main Set:
3 x (5 mins in Z5 + 4 min recoveries in low Z2).

Warm Down:
10 mins in low Z2.

workouts.name: Stanny Loop 2x20min
workouts.detailed_description:
Warm Up:
20 mins in Z2.

Main Set:
2 x (20 mins in upper Z3 + 10 min recoveries in Z2).

Warm Down:
15 mins in low Z2.

workouts.name: Aerobic Endurance Ride 3.3hr
workouts.detailed_description: Ride mainly in Z2 today.

workouts.name: Sub Threshold Efforts 3x20min
workouts.detailed_description:
Warm Up:
15 mins in Z2.

Main Set:
3 x (20 mins in upper Z3 + 5 min recoveries in Z2).

Warm Down:
10 mins in low Z2.

workouts.name: Sub Threshold Efforts 6x10min
workouts.detailed_description:
Warm Up:
22 mins in Z2.

Main Set:
6 x (10 mins in upper Z3 + 3 min recoveries in Z2).

Warm Down:
10 mins in low Z2.

workouts.name: Aerobic Endurance Ride 3.7hr
workouts.detailed_description: Ride mainly in Z2 today. You should be able to maintain conversation at this intensity.

workouts.name: Aerobic Endurance Ride 4hr
workouts.detailed_description: Ride mainly in Z2 today. You should be able to maintain conversation at this intensity.

workouts.name: Aerobic Endurance Ride 4.3hr
workouts.detailed_description: Ride mainly in Z2 today. You should be able to maintain conversation at this intensity.

workouts.name: Aerobic Endurance Ride 5hr
workouts.detailed_description: Ride mainly in Z2 today. You should be able to maintain conversation at this intensity.

workouts.name: Aerobic Endurance Ride 4.7hr
workouts.detailed_description: Ride mainly in Z2 today. You should be able to maintain conversation at this intensity.

workouts.name: Aerobic Endurance Ride 3.5hr
workouts.detailed_description: Ride mainly in Z2 today. You should be able to maintain conversation at this intensity.

workouts.name: Sub Threshold Efforts 2x30min (1.8hr)
workouts.detailed_description:
Warm Up:
20 mins in Z2.

Main Set:
2 x (30 mins in upper Z3 + 10 min recoveries in Z2).

Warm Down:
5 mins in low Z2.

workouts.name: M.A.P Efforts 5x10s (58min)
workouts.detailed_description:
Warm Up:
12 mins in Z2,
5 x (10 secs in Z5 + 50 secs in low Z2),
3 mins in Z2.

Main Set:
7 x (2 mins in Z5 + 2 min recoveries in low Z2).

Warm Down:
10 mins in low Z2.

workouts.name: Above and Below Threshold (10x1min Z3/Z5)
workouts.detailed_description:
These are workouts where the main set includes efforts that alternate above and below your one-hour threshold intensity. They are best done on an indoor trainer.

Warm Up:
15 mins in low Z2,
5 x (10 secs in Z4 + 50 secs in low Z2).

Main Set:
10 x (1 min 30 secs in Z3 + 30 secs in Z5 + 1 min in low Z2).

Warm Down:
10 mins in low Z2.

workouts.name: Sub Threshold Efforts 4x20min (2.2hr)
workouts.detailed_description:
These longer bike sessions are mostly done at an easy/steady Z2 effort, but there is a main set of long efforts at just below your threshold pace. These will help increase your threshold power without leaving you feeling excessively tired afterwards.

Warm Up:
20 mins in Z2.

Main Set:
4 x (20 mins in upper Z3 + 5 min recoveries in Z2).

Warm Down:
10 mins in low Z2.

workouts.name: Sub Threshold Efforts 3x25min
workouts.detailed_description:
Warm Up:
20 mins in Z2.

Main Set:
3 x (25 mins in upper Z3 + 10 min recoveries in Z2).

Warm Down:
25 mins in low Z2.

workouts.name: OPTIONAL: Aerobic Endurance Ride 1hr
workouts.detailed_description:
Ride mainly in Z2 today. You should be able to maintain conversation at this intensity. Don't be tempted to ride harder.

Warm Up:
20 mins in low Z2.

Main Set:
30 mins in upper Z2.

Warm Down:
10 mins in low Z2.

workouts.name: Aerobic Endurance Ride 5x30s (1hr)

5 x (30 secs in upper Z2 + 30 secs in low Z2).

Main Set:
10 mins in upper Z2 + 60 secs recovery in low Z2,
12 mins in upper Z2 + 60 secs recovery in low Z2,
14 mins in upper Z2.

Warm Down:
7 mins in low Z2.

workouts.name: Aerobic Endurance Bike 5x20s (59min)
workouts.detailed_description:
This workout works well on an indoor bike trainer; you can also do it outside. It's not supposed to be high intensity, so keep a lid on this one. You will improve your fat-burning and efficiency.

Warm Up:
10 mins in Z2,
5 x (20 secs in Z3 + 40 secs in low Z2).

Main Set:
12 mins in upper Z2 + 60 secs recovery in low Z2,
4 x (6 mins in upper Z2 + 30 sec recoveries in low Z2).

Warm Down:
5 mins in low Z2.

workouts.detailed_description: Ride at an easy/steady intensity, mainly in Z2 today. You should be able to chat at this intensity. This ride will improve your efficiency for using fat for fuel and increase your ability to transport oxygen to your working muscles.
